intro: Triumfettoides digitata, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are usually lobed and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Triumfettoides digitata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
